MIT\npragma solidity >=0.8.0 <0.9.0;\n\n/**\n * @dev The ChromaticLPAction enum represents the types of LP actions that can be performed.\n */\nenum ChromaticLPAction {\n    ADD_LIQUIDITY,\n    REMOVE_LIQUIDITY\n}\n\n/**\n * @dev The ChromaticLPReceipt struct represents a receipt of an LP action performed.\n * @param id An identifier for the receipt\n * @param provider The address of the msg.sender of the action\n * @param recipient The address of the recipient of the action\n * @param oracleVersion The oracle version associated with the action\n * @param amount The amount involved in the action,\n *        when the action is `ADD_LIQUIDITY`, this value represents the amount of settlement tokens\n *        when the action is `REMOVE_LIQUIDITY`, this value represents the amount of CLB tokens\n * @param pendingLiquidity The amount involved in the action,\n *        when the action is `ADD_LIQUIDITY`, this value represents the amount of pending liquidity in settlement tokens\n *        when the action is `REMOVE_LIQUIDITY`, not used\n * @param action An enumeration representing the type of LP action performed (ADD_LIQUIDITY or REMOVE_LIQUIDITY)\n */\nstruct ChromaticLPReceipt {\n    uint256 id;\n    address provider;\n    address recipient;\n    uint256 oracleVersion;\n    uint256 amount;\n    uint256 pendingLiquidity;\n    ChromaticLPAction action;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x03043442634fe0dca491513f7979f794ef5931c9daca7df07c5e5643e53b645a","license":"MIT"},"contracts/lp/libraries/Constants.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: BUSL-1.1\npragma solidity >=0.8.0 <0.9.0;\n\nuint256 constant BPS = 10000;\n","keccak256":"0x32b6cab57958185ffc60f818f29eb1fab6088840d1cb99487b4a072ea826e3d1","license":"BUSL-1.1"},"contracts/lp/libraries/LPConfig.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity >=0.8.0 <0.9.0;\n\nstruct LPConfig {\n    uint16 utilizationTargetBPS;\n    uint16 rebalanceBPS;\n    uint256 rebalanceCheckingInterval;\n    uint256 settleCheckingInterval;\n}\n\nenum AllocationStatus {\n    InRange,\n    UnderUtilized,\n    OverUtilized\n}\n\nlibrary LPConfigLib {\n    function allocationStatus(\n        LPConfig memory lpconfig,\n        uint256 currentUtility\n    ) internal pure returns (AllocationStatus) {\n        if (uint256(lpconfig.utilizationTargetBPS + lpconfig.rebalanceBPS) < currentUtility) {\n            return AllocationStatus.OverUtilized;\n        } else if (\n            uint256(lpconfig.utilizationTargetBPS - lpconfig.rebalanceBPS) > currentUtility\n        ) {\n            return AllocationStatus.UnderUtilized;\n        } else {\n            return AllocationStatus.InRange;\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x848c0c6a827d9be7786b3e85407c4aeb1a1ddfb49e7dd4e077e57f91dd555684","license":"MIT"},"contracts/lp/libraries/LPState.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity >=0.8.0 <0.9.0;\nimport {IChromaticMarket} from \"@chromatic-protocol/contracts/core/interfaces/IChromaticMarket.sol\";\nimport {ChromaticLPReceipt} from \"~/lp/libraries/ChromaticLPReceipt.sol\";\nimport {EnumerableSet} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/structs/EnumerableSet.sol\";\n\nstruct LPState {\n    IChromaticMarket market;\n    int16[] feeRates;\n    mapping(int16 => uint16) distributionRates;\n    uint256[] clbTokenIds;\n    mapping(uint256 => ChromaticLPReceipt) receipts; // receiptId => receipt\n    mapping(uint256 => EnumerableSet.UintSet) lpReceiptMap; // receiptId => lpReceiptIds\n    mapping(address => EnumerableSet.UintSet) providerReceiptIds; // provider => receiptIds\n    uint256 pendingAddAmount; // in settlement token\n    mapping(int16 => uint256) pendingRemoveClbAmounts; // feeRate => pending remove\n    uint256 receiptId;\n}\n","keccak256":"0xfaae77dcc6e99a63489cc83c04c1b8cc1d8a94da5bce058cdc66c6176dd0b819","license":"MIT"},"contracts/lp/libraries/LPStateLogic.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity >=0.8.0 <0.9.0;\n\nimport {LPState} from \"~/lp/libraries/LPState.sol\";\nimport {IChromaticMarket} from \"@chromatic-protocol/contracts/core/interfaces/IChromaticMarket.sol\";\nimport {IChromaticLPErrors} from \"~/lp/interfaces/IChromaticLPErrors.sol\";\nimport {BPS} from \"~/lp/libraries/Constants.sol\";\n\nimport {IKeeperFeePayer} from \"@chromatic-protocol/contracts/core/interfaces/IKeeperFeePayer.sol\";\n// import {SafeERC20, IERC20} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol\";\nimport {EnumerableSet} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/structs/EnumerableSet.sol\";\nimport {ChromaticLPReceipt, ChromaticLPAction} from \"~/lp/libraries/ChromaticLPReceipt.sol\";\nimport {LPStateViewLib} from \"~/lp/libraries/LPStateView.sol\";\nimport {Math} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol\";\nimport {LpReceipt} from \"@chromatic-protocol/contracts/core/libraries/LpReceipt.sol\";\nimport {ChromaticLPLogicBase} from \"~/lp/base/ChromaticLPLogicBase.sol\";\n\nlibrary LPStateLogicLib {\n    using Math for uint256;\n    using EnumerableSet for EnumerableSet.UintSet;\n    using LPStateViewLib for LPState;\n    using LPStateLogicLib for LPState;\n\n    function nextReceiptId(LPState storage s_state) internal returns (uint256 id) {\n        id = ++s_state.receiptId;\n    }\n\n    function addReceipt(\n        LPState storage s_state,\n        ChromaticLPReceipt memory receipt,\n        LpReceipt[] memory lpReceipts\n    ) internal {\n        s_state.receipts[receipt.id] = receipt;\n        EnumerableSet.UintSet storage lpReceiptIdSet = s_state.lpReceiptMap[receipt.id];\n        for (uint256 i; i < lpReceipts.length; ) {\n            //slither-disable-next-line unused-return\n            lpReceiptIdSet.add(lpReceipts[i].id);\n\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n\n        EnumerableSet.UintSet storage receiptIdSet = s_state.providerReceiptIds[msg.sender];\n        //slither-disable-next-line unused-return\n        receiptIdSet.add(receipt.id);\n    }\n\n    function removeReceipt(LPState storage s_state, uint256 receiptId) internal {\n        ChromaticLPReceipt memory receipt = s_state.getReceipt(receiptId);\n        delete s_state.receipts[receiptId];\n        delete s_state.lpReceiptMap[receiptId];\n\n        EnumerableSet.UintSet storage receiptIdSet = s_state.providerReceiptIds[receipt.provider];\n        //slither-disable-next-line unused-return\n        receiptIdSet.remove(receiptId);\n    }\n\n    function claimLiquidity(\n        LPState storage s_state,\n        ChromaticLPReceipt memory receipt,\n        uint256 keeperFee\n    ) internal {\n        // pass ChromaticLPReceipt as calldata\n        // mint and transfer lp pool token to provider in callback\n        s_state.market.claimLiquidityBatch(\n            s_state.lpReceiptMap[receipt.id].values(),\n            abi.encode(receipt, keeperFee)\n        );\n\n        s_state.removeReceipt(receipt.id);\n    }\n\n    function withdrawLiquidity(\n        LPState storage s_state,\n        ChromaticLPReceipt memory receipt,\n        uint256 keeperFee\n    ) internal {\n        // do claim\n        // pass ChromaticLPReceipt as calldata\n        s_state.market.withdrawLiquidityBatch(\n            s_state.lpReceiptMap[receipt.id].values(),\n            abi.encode(receipt, keeperFee)\n        );\n\n        s_state.removeReceipt(receipt.id);\n    }\n\n    function distributeAmount(\n        LPState storage s_state,\n        uint256 amount\n    ) internal view returns (uint256[] memory amounts, uint256 totalAmount) {\n        amounts = new uint256[](s_state.binCount());\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < s_state.binCount(); ) {\n            uint256 _amount = amount.mulDiv(s_state.distributionRates[s_state.feeRates[i]], BPS);\n\n            amounts[i] = _amount;\n            totalAmount += _amount;\n\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    function addLiquidity(\n        LPState storage s_state,\n        uint256 amount,\n        uint256 liquidityTarget,\n        address recipient\n    ) internal returns (ChromaticLPReceipt memory receipt) {\n        (uint256[] memory amounts, uint256 liquidityAmount) = s_state.distributeAmount(\n            liquidityTarget\n        );\n\n        LpReceipt[] memory lpReceipts = s_state.market.addLiquidityBatch(\n            address(this),\n            s_state.feeRates,\n            amounts,\n            abi.encode(\n                ChromaticLPLogicBase.AddLiquidityBatchCallbackData({\n                    provider: msg.sender,\n                    liquidityAmount: liquidityAmount,\n                    holdingAmount: amount - liquidityAmount\n                })\n            )\n        );\n\n        receipt = ChromaticLPReceipt({\n            id: s_state.nextReceiptId(),\n            provider: msg.sender,\n            recipient: recipient,\n            oracleVersion: lpReceipts[0].oracleVersion,\n            amount: amount,\n            pendingLiquidity: liquidityAmount,\n            action: ChromaticLPAction.ADD_LIQUIDITY\n        });\n\n        s_state.addReceipt(receipt, lpReceipts);\n        s_state.pendingAddAmount += liquidityAmount;\n    }\n\n    function removeLiquidity(\n        LPState storage s_state,\n        uint256[] memory clbTokenAmounts,\n        uint256 lpTokenAmount,\n        address recipient\n    ) internal returns (ChromaticLPReceipt memory receipt) {\n        LpReceipt[] memory lpReceipts = s_state.market.removeLiquidityBatch(\n            address(this),\n            s_state.feeRates,\n            clbTokenAmounts,\n            abi.encode(\n                ChromaticLPLogicBase.RemoveLiquidityBatchCallbackData({\n                    provider: msg.sender,\n                    lpTokenAmount: lpTokenAmount,\n                    clbTokenAmounts: clbTokenAmounts\n                })\n            )\n        );\n\n        receipt = ChromaticLPReceipt({\n            id: s_state.nextReceiptId(),\n            provider: msg.sender,\n            recipient: recipient,\n            oracleVersion: lpReceipts[0].oracleVersion,\n            amount: lpTokenAmount,\n            pendingLiquidity: 0,\n            action: ChromaticLPAction.REMOVE_LIQUIDITY\n        });\n\n        s_state.addReceipt(receipt, lpReceipts);\n        s_state.increasePendingClb(lpReceipts);\n    }\n\n    function increasePendingClb(LPState storage s_state, LpReceipt[] memory lpReceipts) internal {\n        for (uint256 i; i < lpReceipts.length; ) {\n            s_state.pendingRemoveClbAmounts[lpReceipts[i].tradingFeeRate] += lpReceipts[i].amount;\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    function decreasePendingClb(\n        LPState storage s_state,\n        int16[] calldata _feeRates,\n        uint256[] calldata burnedCLBTokenAmounts\n    ) internal {\n        for (uint256 i; i < _feeRates.length; ) {\n            s_state.pendingRemoveClbAmounts[_feeRates[i]] -= burnedCLBTokenAmounts[i];\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    function calcRemoveClbAmounts(\n        LPState storage s_state,\n        uint256 lpTokenAmount,\n        uint256 totalSupply\n    ) internal view returns (uint256[] memory clbTokenAmounts) {\n        uint256 binCount = s_state.binCount();\n        address[] memory _owners = new address[](binCount);\n        for (uint256 i; i < binCount; ) {\n            _owners[i] = address(this);\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n        uint256[] memory _clbTokenBalances = s_state.clbToken().balanceOfBatch(\n            _owners,\n            s_state.clbTokenIds\n        );\n\n        clbTokenAmounts = new uint256[](binCount);\n        for (uint256 i; i < binCount; ) {\n            clbTokenAmounts[i] = _clbTokenBalances[i].mulDiv(\n                lpTokenAmount,\n                totalSupply,\n                Math.Rounding.Up\n            );\n\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x3a2a251a5b0c8ab431d75ff04fd79f74815be6b78bcf4fb249ca223e11721cfa","license":"MIT"},"contracts/lp/libraries/LPStateSetup.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity >=0.8.0 <0.9.0;\n\nimport {LPState} from \"~/lp/libraries/LPState.sol\";\nimport {IChromaticMarket} from \"@chromatic-protocol/contracts/core/interfaces/IChromaticMarket.sol\";\nimport {IChromaticLPErrors} from \"~/lp/interfaces/IChromaticLPErrors.sol\";\nimport {BPS} from \"~/lp/libraries/Constants.sol\";\nimport {CLBTokenLib} from \"@chromatic-protocol/contracts/core/libraries/CLBTokenLib.sol\";\n\nlibrary LPStateSetupLib {\n    function initialize(\n        LPState storage s_state,\n        IChromaticMarket market,\n        int16[] memory feeRates,\n        uint16[] memory distributionRates\n    ) internal {\n        s_state.market = market;\n        _setupState(s_state, feeRates, distributionRates);\n    }\n\n    function _setupState(\n        LPState storage s_state,\n        int16[] memory feeRates,\n        uint16[] memory distributionRates\n    ) private {\n        uint16 totalRate;\n        for (uint256 i; i < distributionRates.length; ) {\n            s_state.distributionRates[feeRates[i]] = distributionRates[i];\n            totalRate += distributionRates[i];\n\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n        if (totalRate != BPS) revert IChromaticLPErrors.InvalidDistributionSum();\n        s_state.feeRates = feeRates;\n\n        _setupClbTokenIds(s_state, feeRates);\n    }\n\n    function _setupClbTokenIds(LPState storage s_state, int16[] memory _feeRates) private {\n        s_state.clbTokenIds = new uint256[](_feeRates.length);\n        for (uint256 i; i < _feeRates.length; ) {\n            s_state.clbTokenIds[i] = CLBTokenLib.encodeId(_feeRates[i]);\n\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x35847083d06ed4b40175d988e9b1f50da7fe3bfa4f9a5e89ef09d68b2bdf772b","license":"MIT"},"contracts/lp/libraries/LPStateValue.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity >=0.8.0 <0.9.0;\n\nimport {LPState} from \"~/lp/libraries/LPState.sol\";\nimport {ValueInfo} from \"~/lp/interfaces/IChromaticLPLens.sol\";\nimport {BPS} from \"~/lp/libraries/Constants.sol\";\nimport {IERC1155} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/interfaces/IERC1155.sol\";\nimport {IERC20} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol\";\nimport {Math} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol\";\nimport {LPStateViewLib} from \"~/lp/libraries/LPStateView.sol\";\n\nlibrary LPStateValueLib {\n    using LPStateValueLib for LPState;\n    using LPStateViewLib for LPState;\n\n    using Math for uint256;\n\n    function utilizationInfo(\n        LPState storage s_state\n    ) internal view returns (uint16 currentUtility, uint256 _totalValue) {\n        ValueInfo memory value = s_state.valueInfo();\n        _totalValue = value.total;\n        if (_totalValue == 0) {\n            currentUtility = 0;\n        } else {\n            currentUtility = uint16(\n                uint256(value.total - (value.holding + value.pendingClb)).mulDiv(BPS, value.total)\n            );\n        }\n    }\n\n    function totalValue(LPState storage s_state) internal view returns (uint256 value) {\n        value = (s_state.holdingValue() + s_state.pendingValue() + s_state.totalClbValue());\n    }\n\n    function valueInfo(LPState storage s_state) internal view returns (ValueInfo memory info) {\n        info = ValueInfo({\n            total: 0,\n            holding: s_state.holdingValue(),\n            pending: s_state.pendingValue(),\n            holdingClb: s_state.holdingClbValue(),\n            pendingClb: s_state.pendingClbValue()\n        });\n        info.total = info.holding + info.pending + info.holdingClb + info.pendingClb;\n    }\n\n    function holdingValue(LPState storage s_state) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return s_state.settlementToken().balanceOf(address(this));\n    }\n\n    function pendingValue(LPState storage s_state) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return s_state.pendingAddAmount;\n    }\n\n    function holdingClbValue(LPState storage s_state) internal view returns (uint256 value) {\n        uint256[] memory clbSupplies = s_state.market.clbToken().totalSupplyBatch(\n            s_state.clbTokenIds\n        );\n        uint256[] memory binValues = s_state.market.getBinValues(s_state.feeRates);\n        uint256[] memory clbTokenAmounts = s_state.clbTokenBalances();\n        for (uint256 i; i < binValues.length; ) {\n            uint256 clbAmount = clbTokenAmounts[i];\n            value += clbAmount == 0 ? 0 : clbAmount.mulDiv(binValues[i], clbSupplies[i]);\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    function pendingClbValue(LPState storage s_state) internal view returns (uint256 value) {\n        uint256[] memory clbSupplies = s_state.market.clbToken().totalSupplyBatch(\n            s_state.clbTokenIds\n        );\n        uint256[] memory binValues = s_state.market.getBinValues(s_state.feeRates);\n        for (uint256 i; i < binValues.length; ) {\n            uint256 clbAmount = s_state.pendingRemoveClbAmounts[s_state.feeRates[i]];\n            value += clbAmount == 0 ? 0 : clbAmount.mulDiv(binValues[i], clbSupplies[i]);\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    function totalClbValue(LPState storage s_state) internal view returns (uint256 value) {\n        uint256[] memory clbSupplies = s_state.market.clbToken().totalSupplyBatch(\n            s_state.clbTokenIds\n        );\n        uint256[] memory binValues = s_state.market.getBinValues(s_state.feeRates);\n        uint256[] memory clbTokenAmounts = s_state.clbTokenBalances();\n        for (uint256 i; i < binValues.length; ) {\n            uint256 clbAmount = clbTokenAmounts[i] +\n                s_state.pendingRemoveClbAmounts[s_state.feeRates[i]];\n            value += clbAmount == 0 ? 0 : clbAmount.mulDiv(binValues[i], clbSupplies[i]);\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    function clbTokenBalances(\n        LPState storage s_state\n    ) internal view returns (uint256[] memory _clbTokenBalances) {\n        address[] memory _owners = new address[](s_state.binCount());\n        for (uint256 i; i < s_state.binCount(); ) {\n            _owners[i] = address(this);\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n        _clbTokenBalances = s_state.clbToken().balanceOfBatch(_owners, s_state.clbTokenIds);\n    }\n\n    function pendingRemoveClbBalances(\n        LPState storage s_state\n    ) internal view returns (uint256[] memory pendingBalances) {\n        pendingBalances = new uint256[](s_state.binCount());\n        for (uint256 i; i < s_state.binCount(); ) {\n            pendingBalances[i] = s_state.pendingRemoveClbAmounts[s_state.feeRates[i]];\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x75051e00dd039d77c1c38d4b7a39fbf04840bd64907e8d75424f6580b1c04c45","license":"MIT"},"contracts/lp/libraries/LPStateView.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity >=0.8.0 <0.9.0;\n\nimport {LPState} from \"~/lp/libraries/LPState.sol\";\nimport {IERC1155} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/interfaces/IERC1155.sol\";\nimport {IERC20Metadata} from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/interfaces/IERC20Metadata.sol\";\nimport {ChromaticLPReceipt} from \"~/lp/libraries/ChromaticLPReceipt.sol\";\nimport {IOracleProvider} from \"@chromatic-protocol/contracts/oracle/interfaces/IOracleProvider.sol\";\n\nlibrary LPStateViewLib {\n    using LPStateViewLib for LPState;\n\n    function settlementToken(LPState storage s_state) internal view returns (IERC20Metadata) {\n        return s_state.market.settlementToken();\n    }\n\n    function clbToken(LPState storage s_state) internal view returns (IERC1155) {\n        return s_state.market.clbToken();\n    }\n\n    function getReceipt(\n        LPState storage s_state,\n        uint256 receiptId\n    ) internal view returns (ChromaticLPReceipt memory) {\n        return s_state.receipts[receiptId];\n    }\n\n    function binCount(LPState storage s_state) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return s_state.feeRates.length;\n    }\n\n    function oracleVersion(LPState storage s_state) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return s_state.market.oracleProvider().currentVersion().version;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x92b6aef78b34686759ac7ced4979abe31b7c654d9f007fa91d52923f6cf4f547","license":"MIT"},"contracts/lp/libraries/TrimAddress.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity >=0.8.0 <0.9.0;\n\nlibrary TrimAddress {\n    function trimAddress(\n        address self,\n        uint8 length\n    ) internal pure returns (bytes memory converted) {\n        converted = new bytes(length);\n        bytes memory _base = \"0123456789abcdef\";\n        uint160 value = uint160(self);\n\n        value = value >> (4 * (39 - length));\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < length; ) {\n            value = value >> 4;\n            converted[length - i - 1] = _base[uint8(value % 16)];\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x058d5dd19ce5c9528aa61a603c79680f1fb0479607f822cf0024edca9736f5be","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity addition.
params.settlementToken: The address of the settlement token used for adding liquidity.
params.vault: The address of the vault where the liquidity is added.

params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity addition.
params.settlementToken: The address of the settlement token used for adding liquidity.
params.vault: The address of the vault where the liquidity is added.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity claim.
params.depositedAmounts: The array of deposited liquidity amounts for each receipt in the batch.
params.feeRates: The array of trading fee rates associated with each claim in the batch.
params.mintedCLBTokenAmounts: The array of CLB token amounts minted for each receipt in the batch.
params.receiptIds: The array of the liquidity receipt IDs.

params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity claim.
params.feeRate: The trading fee rate associated with the liquidity claim.
params.mintedCLBTokenAmount: The amount of CLB tokens minted as liquidity.
params.receiptId: The ID of the liquidity claim receipt.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,u.details: Handles the receipt of a multiple ERC1155 token types. This function is called at the end of a `safeBatchTransferFrom` after the balances have been updated. NOTE: To accept the transfer(s), this must return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)"))` (i.e. 0xbc197c81, or its own function selector).

params.data: Additional data with no specified format
params.from: The address which previously owned the token
params.ids: An array containing ids of each token being transferred (order and length must match values array)
params.operator: The address which initiated the batch transfer (i.e. msg.sender)
params.values: An array containing amounts of each token being transferred (order and length must match ids array)

onERC1155Received(address,address,uint25.details: Handles the receipt of a single ERC1155 token type. This function is called at the end of a `safeTransferFrom` after the balance has been updated. NOTE: To accept the transfer, this must return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155Received(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)"))` (i.e. 0xf23a6e61, or its own function selector).

params.data: Additional data with no specified format
params.from: The address which previously owned the token
params.id: The ID of the token being transferred
params.operator: The address which initiated the transfer (i.e. msg.sender)
params.value: The amount of tokens being transferred

params.clbToken: The address of the Chromatic liquidity token.
params.clbTokenIds: The array of the Chromatic liquidity token IDs to be removed.
params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity removal.

params.clbToken: The address of the Chromatic liquidity token.
params.clbTokenId: The ID of the Chromatic liquidity token to be removed.
params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity removal.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

params.burnedCLBTokenAmounts: The array of CLB token amounts burned for each receipt in the batch.
params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity withdrawal.
params.feeRates: The array of trading fee rates associated with each withdrawal in the batch.
params.receiptIds: The array of the liquidity receipt IDs.
params.withdrawnAmounts: The array of withdrawn liquidity amounts for each receipt in the batch.

params.burnedCLBTokenAmount: The amount of CLB tokens burned during the withdrawal.
params.data: Additional data associated with the liquidity withdrawal.
params.feeRate: The trading fee rate associated with the liquidity withdrawal.
params.receiptId: The ID of the liquidity withdrawal receipt.
params.withdrawnAmount: The amount of liquidity that has been withdrawn.

addLiquidityBatchCallback(address,addres.notice: Handles the callback after adding liquidity to the Chromatic protocol.

addLiquidityCallback(address,address,byt.notice: Handles the callback after adding liquidity to the Chromatic protocol.

claimLiquidityBatchCallback(uint256[],in.notice: Handles the callback after claiming liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.

claimLiquidityCallback(uint256,int16,uin.notice: Handles the callback after claiming liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.

removeLiquidityBatchCallback(address,uin.notice: Handles the callback after removing liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.

removeLiquidityCallback(address,uint256,.notice: Handles the callback after removing liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.

withdrawLiquidityBatchCallback(uint256[].notice: Handles the callback after withdrawing liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.

withdrawLiquidityCallback(uint256,int16,.notice: Handles the callback after withdrawing liquidity from the Chromatic protocol.
